{{Template:FR:RailwaySignalStateDescription
|fullname=Carré
|state=C
|description=
Two steady red lights, either arranged vertically or horizontally.

Signals that can display this state, also known as '''Carré''' signals, are equipped with both a clearing light ('''œilleton''') and an '''Nf''' (''Non franchissable'') plate. The clearing light is always lit except when the Carré state is displayed.
|action=
Absolute Stop.
}}
